column4: Does this happen all the time and what kind of cpu do you have?
sorry, was trolling the net, yes, it happens with pretty high freq AMD64 proc
OK. And cpu goes up to 100%?
Are you running the 64bit version of Ubuntu?
yes I am running the 64bit version
I can't help you, as I am running 32bit with an AMD64 x2 5000+ with nvidia7600. Have no problem with that.
I cannot confirm your problem. Two finger scrolling is working for me in nautilus. Maybe you find something in the nautilus settings. Otherwise try to remove/rename the .config/nautilus folder once .
it was working, but it just suddenly stopped, I'll try killing it and restarting
ok, I was wrong, it's not working in most things, just Skype and Chrome it seems to work (weird eh?)
What are the mouse/touchpad settings in the ubuntu settings. Could you check if at least the 'edge scrolling' setting is working?
will do
edge-scrolling works on nothing, not even chrome or skype
scratch that, it works on chrome and skype, but not others

ok. I don't know if I can really help you. You would have to figure out what kind of touchpad you are using and what driver. All I can say is, that synaptics based touchpads are working well, atleast on two machines I configured for 12.04.
I think I probably just ought to give up and restart, see if that gets it
restart solved the issue. still wish I knew what exactly caused it though, do you know what I could look for in the logs? just synaptics?
Don't know really, as the touchpad is handled by the xserver. It would probably be some X error.
yikes, that probably won't be so easy to find
Exactly...
dmesg |grep syna <-- check if you have a synaptics based touchpad
already tried, it just showed when it loaded the driver
